_header: Surge mea sponsa so sweet in sight
_description: ‘Veni coronaberis’, a song of Christ to the Virgin Mary — nine 8-linestanzas

BlCottCalAII.First Lines:
Surge mea sponsa so swete in syȝteAnd se þy sone in sete
                    full shene…
BlCottCalAII.Last Lines:
…Thus enyeth þis songe of gret swetenesseVeni
                    coronaberis
BlCottCalAII.Note:
‘Explicit’ by scribe beneath last line, f.
                    108ra.
BlCottCalAII.Attributed Title:
Veni Coronaberis (in upper margin f. 108 above col. a); Veni
                        coronaberis (f. 1, sixteenth-century list of contents)
BlCottCalAII.Editions:
Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 65-7.

BLHar2251.First Lines:
Surge mea sponsa so swete in sightCom se thy sone that soke so
                    shene…
BLHar2251.Last Lines:
…Veni CoronaberisDulcra bona thow berist the nameAs the
                    sonne that shynes so clere

Lam853.First Lines:
SUrge mea sponsa swete in siȝtAnd se þi sone þou
                    ȝafe souke so scheeneÞou schalt abide with þi babe so
                    briȝtAnd in my glorie be callide a queene…
Lam853.Last Lines:
…So beningne a ladi of such briȝtnesÞis is þe
                    color of kinde clennesRegina celi þat neuere dide mysÞus
                    eendiþ þe song of greet swettnesVeni cornaberis
Lam853.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             Hymns to the Virgin and Christ…and other religious poems.
EETS
         o.s. 24 (1867); repr. 1973: 1-3.
